articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The killing of Yolanda Sanchez comes just hours after a historic landslide victory for Mexico's first woman president.
articles.title: Mexico election: Mayor killed after first woman elected leader

articles.description: DNA tests have confirmed all three infants found in east London are full siblings, the BBC can report.
articles.title: Abandoned baby Elsa is third newborn deserted by same parents

articles.description: Sir Keir Starmer says "security will always come first" under his Labour, distancing himself from Jeremy Corbyn.
articles.title: Keir Starmer says he would use nuclear weapons if needed

articles.description: Police say they have not found any criminal intent in the mishap, but an investigation is ongoing.
articles.title: Nebraska woman declared dead found alive at funeral home

articles.description: Toyota has apologised for providing incorrect or manipulated data for safety certification tests.
articles.title: Toyota: World's largest carmaker raided over safety scandal

articles.description: The Trump campaign has seen upticks in fundraising during pivotal moments of his legal battles.
articles.title: The billionaires rallying behind Trump after his conviction

articles.description: Donald Tusk is urging Poles to vote for his coalition, to best protect against Russian aggression.
articles.title: Poland's PM delivers stark warning ahead of EU elections

articles.description: Flood waters are continuing to rise in parts of southern Germany, and are now spreading down the Danube to Austria and Hungary.
articles.title: Germany's deadly floods spread along Danube

articles.description: Maureen Sweeney's weather report from Blacksod Lighthouse in Mayo helped persuade Allied commanders.
articles.title: The Irish lighthouse keeper who gave D-Day the go-ahead

articles.description: The Reform UK leader is showered with banana milkshake as he campaigns in Essex.
articles.title: Farage has drink thrown on him at Clacton election launch
